summary:
The Roman Republic was a period in ancient Roman history from 509 BC to 27 BC. It began when the Roman Kingdom was overthrown and ended with the rise of the Roman Empire. During this time, Rome grew from a small city-state to a powerful nation ruling the entire Mediterranean.

Rome fought many wars, including against Carthage and various kings, becoming the region's dominant power. At home, there were struggles between the rich and poor, leading to political changes. The Republic faced civil wars, with leaders like Marius, Sulla, Caesar, and Octavian fighting for control. Octavian's victory and the Senate's power transfer to him as Augustus marked the Republic's end.
title: Roman Republic
